title: Traffic flow through an intersection part - d

content.description: Traffic flow is defined as the rate at which cars pass through an intersection, measured in cars per minute. The traffic flow at a particular intersection is modeled by the function F defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>82</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGgbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaI4aGaaGOmaiabgUcaRiaaisdaciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gadaqada WdaeaapeWaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaadshaa8aabaWdbiaaikdaaaaacaGL OaGaayzkaaaaaa@4429@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaIWaGaeyizImQaamiDaiabgsMiJkaaiodacaaIWaaaaa@3CAA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, where F(t) is measured in cars per minute and t is measured in minutes.
content.question: What is the average rate of change of the traffic flow over the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>15</mn> </mrow> </math> ? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: What is the average rate of change of the traffic flow over the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>15</mn> </mrow> </math> ? Indicate units of measure.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
